note: Specialized runner - see extra_data for details

vulnerability_location.description: The call `winningAddress.transfer(prize)` can fail if the winner is a contract that reverts or uses more than 2300 gas, causing chooseWinner (and thus buyTickets) to revert and blocking the raffle indefinitely.
Randomness derived from predictable on-chain values block.coinbase, msg.sender, and block.difficulty

The random seed includes msg.sender (seed2) and chooseWinner is called atomically when the last ticket is bought in buyTickets. An attacker can front-run the final buyTickets transaction to ensure they are msg.sender and bias the outcome.
Floating pragma version; use of '^0.4.16' allows the contract to be compiled with different compiler versions, potentially introducing inconsistent or unsafe behavior
